intro: Chirita forrestii var. acutidentata, commonly known as the sharp-toothed chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam and Laos. The plant is characterized by its small, elongated leaves with serrated edges and clusters of tubular, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is a sought-after plant among horticulturists and botanists.
